Description: Fragment of a wooden beam, consisting of a lightweight splinter, broken at both ends. One end possibly retains part of a circular drilled hole.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east-north-east face of the casemate building B
Curator's comments: Like London, BM EA 23992, this fragment could be from one of the beams regularly laid between bricks to reinforce the structure of the walls, as usual for Late period mudbrick construction with concave courses. On "beam holes" visible in Chamber 22, see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 56 § 55, without following Petrie's hypothesis of a "roof". See also Boston, MFA, 87.14
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.55, p.56, p.176, pl.18)
